org.tantalum.util
Class LengthLimitedVector

java.lang.Object
  java.util.AbstractCollection
      java.util.AbstractList
          java.util.Vector
              org.tantalum.util.LengthLimitedVector
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Iterable, java.util.Collection, java.util.List, java.util.RandomAccess
public abstract class LengthLimitedVector
extends java.util.Vector

A collection which calls lengthExceeded() when the designated maximum size is reached. Your implementation can use this to limit growth by trimming the collection.

Author:
phou
See Also:
Serialized Form

Constructor Summary
LengthLimitedVector(int maxLength)
          Create a new limited-size collection, specifying the maximum allowed size.
 
Method Summary
 void addElement(java.lang.Object o)
          Add one element to the collection
 boolean isLengthExceeded()
          Indicates if the collection is larger than expected
 boolean markAsExtra(java.lang.Object o)
          Remove the object and call lengthExceeded() on it, treating it as if the Vector has outgrown its bounds.
 void setMaxLength(int maxLength)
          Change the maximum allowed size for the collection
